project.teaser: This Action will upscale the successful citizen science initiative “Plastic Pirates – Go Europe!” to interested EU Member States (MS) and Horizon Europe Associated Countries (AC). In doing so, the action aims to raise awareness among citizens and, in particular, young...
project.objective: This Action will upscale the successful citizen science initiative “Plastic Pirates – Go Europe!” to interested EU Member States (MS) and Horizon Europe Associated Countries (AC). In doing so, the action aims to raise awareness among citizens and, in particular, young citizens, in larger parts of Europe on the impact and benefits that research and innovation can have on their daily lives, to increase the capacity to collect, organise and verify data on plastic waste pollution stemming from and in European rivers, coastlines and seas, and to test, replicate and refine best practice models for linking excellent science and citizen engagement in order to reach the Mission Ocean's objective of restoring our ocean, seas and waters while supporting the monitoring of EU policy objectives.
project.title: UPSCALING THE PLASTIC PIRATES CITIZEN SCIENCE INITIATIVE
project.keywords: Plastic Pirates, plastic pollution, environmental pollution, litter pollution of rivers, citizen science, European rivers, coastlines and ocean, Mission Ocean

result.title: Report on tested replicable best practice models for linking excellent science and citizen engagement
result.description: Building upon the draft version presented in the proposal the strategy will includeclear target groups means to reach those target groups all the planned DECtools and measures to be developed for the action as well as indicators and target values Regarding the multiple target groups the plan will include countryregionspecific and countryregionsensitive approaches how to communicate successfully with the multiple groups in the various participating MSAC Generally the plan will identify in detail the management strategies for the use of communication dissemination and exploitation means Exploitation will be built strategically upon the communication and dissemination activities and will have a broader scope to ensure an ongoing validation of action assets throughout the action and to further concretise the value and societal and scientific impact of action results

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: The Data Management Plan (DMP) describes the data management procedures for all data to be collected, processed and/or generated in the framework of this action in line with the Guidelines on FAIR Data Management in Horizon Europe. The term FAIR describes a set of guiding principles to make data Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, and Reusable. This Plan will also concern all intellectual property management, such as dealing with partner’s background needed for the purposes of the action and granting access rights to partners, but also IP related issues concerning publications or dissemination of deliverables/outputs.

result.title: Performance report on the progress of the initiative
result.description: DLR will create a performance report with regular updates that summarizes the progress and performance of the initiative The report will include qualitative and quantitative assessmentsshort reports by the local partners on how the initiative is progressing incl challenges potential for improvement shortcomings number of schoolsyouth groups reached out to number of schoolsyouth groups mobilized and the number of pupils in this group number of samplings conducted number of samplings that were incomplete number of entries on the websites single data entry point number of materials that reached the participants downloads and prints number of sampling nets deployed all assessments per country and per sampling period and other

result.title: Quality Assurance Plan
result.description: The Plan will describe a harmonised process of quality assurance for the activities conducted in the different WPs In order to have a consistent impact assessment after each of the actions activities it is essential to have one centralised quality assurance task management with appropriate performance indicators of action tasks The following cornerstones will be covered by this plan Appropriate performance indicators at action start process of monitoring qualitystandarts and processes for the permanent QA

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - PlasticPiratesEU (UPSCALING THE PLASTIC PIRATES CITIZEN SCIENCE INITIATIVE)
result.teaser: Environmental pollution by plastic litter is a pervasive, large-scale and international problem. It has been most researched in the marine environment, where it is estimated that around 13 million tons of plastic litter annually end up being washed into the ocean from land...

webItem.alternativeText: Kick-off Event "Europeanisation of the Plastic Pirates - Go Europe initiative" in Burgas, Bulgaria

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: PPEU initiative common and harmonized standards to data sampling, processing, analysis and storage
result.description: This report will follow up on several workshops hosted by DLR and provide the following common and harmonized standards to sampling processing analysis and storage of dataharmonise plastic litter collection and data processing of the initiative with EUwide efforts to establish a more standardised approach to plastic litter monitoring and categorisationagree on common standards to sampling data collection processing analysis and storage eg methods to macroplastics and microplastics data with open access of data on line with FAIR principles

result.title: Translated and adapted educational, outreach and sampling materials (most likely into Hungarian, Italian, Dutch, Spanish, Norwegian, Lithuanian, and Greek language)
result.description: Building on WP1 and with MSAC that join the initiative identified DLR will translate the already existing educational outreach and sampling materials as well as the website and central data entry point into local languages Any requested cultural adaptions will aslo be provided in the translated documents Translation will be done for those countries joining the initiative If budget allows we will translate into further official languages of the EUThe translated materials and website will be reviewed in close cooperation with local partners to correct translations errors or unclear expressions All translated materials will be provided as downloadlink on the webpage

result.title: Report on Plastic Pirates’ data
result.description: DLR will support the post sampling phase and create a report on processed verified analysed stored and shared Plastic Pirates data which includes mainly a quantitative assessment of the number of uploaded macroplastic data sets processedthe number of FTIR spectroscopies performed short reports on MSAC results analysis along various indicators litter quantities and composition of litter on the riverside litter accumulation and findings of hazardous material on the river bank disposables on the riverside floating litter in the river large microplastics in the river 1mm potential sources of litter along the riverside etc

result.title: Dissemination, exploitation and communication Strategy
result.description: DLR will develop a Communication Dissemination Exploitation Strategy that builds upon the draft version presented in the proposal The strategy will includeClear target groups means to reach those target groups all the planned DECtools and measures to be developed for the action as well as indicators and target values Regarding the multiple target groups the plan will include countryregionspecific and countryregionsensitive approaches how to communicate successfully with the multiple groups in the various participating MSACGenerally the plan will identify in detail the management strategies for the use of communication dissemination and exploitation means Exploitation will be built strategically upon the communication and dissemination activities and will have a broader scope to ensure an ongoing validation of action assets throughout the action and to further concretise the value and societal and scientific impact of action results

result.title: Promotion Brochure and Presentation „How to join the Plastic Pirates”
result.description: DLR will continuously outreach and mobilize MSAC via relevant working groups conferences events and fora such as the European Research Area and Innovation Committee ERAC and the European Research Area Forum to join the initiativeTo better promote and convey the PPEU initiative and what is needed to join the initiative a promotion brochure and presentation How to join the Plastic Pirates will be developed The brochure will inform about the details of the initiative and to secure further support by the respective MSAC ministries

result.title: Plastic Pirates – Go Europe! Project booklet
Plastic Pirates – Go Europe! Project booklet coasts and beaches
Toolkit for local partners including templates in Plastic Pirates design for communicating on the initiative
result.description: This toolkit aims to support the communication activities of the local partners in order to ensure synchronisation of the various local and European communication activitiesMSAC are invited to develop and launch their own communication measures depending on countryspecific needs and preferences These communication activities are supported by DLR via templates and best practices examples from previous sampling campaigns In order to have a common action identity a Plastic Pirates corporate design kit is developed and communicated by DLR In addition DLR will support in settingup local Plastic Pirates social media channels in local language

category.title: pollution
category.displayCode: /natural sciences/earth and related environmental sciences/environmental sciences/pollution

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
